Presence of the minimum area of that BEC zone in one of the current or projected periods

Name: Bird Species Richness 2071-2100
Description:
Maximum number of bird species with potential habitat from suitability models based on the future climate scenarios RCP 4.5 for 2071-2100 for North America. Results of 242 species suitability models based on the current distribution and two future climate scenarios (RCP 4.5 and 8.5) for three time intervals (2025, 2055, 2085) for North America.

Value Interpretation:

The sum of all suitability species range in the planning unit

Reference:

Bateman, B.L., C.B. Wilsey, L. Taylor, J. Wu, G.S. LeBaron, and G. Langham. 2020. North American birds require mitigation and adaptation to reduce vulnerability to climate change. Conservation Science and Practice

Name: Tree Species Richness 2071-2100
Description:
Maximum number of tree species with potential habitat from suitability models based on the future climate scenarios RCP 4.5 for 2071-2100 for North America. Results of 324 species suitability models based on the current distribution and two future climate scenarios (RCP 4.5 and 8.5) for three time intervals (2025, 2055, 2085) for North America.

Value Interpretation:

The sum of all suitability species range in the planning unit

Reference:

McKenney, D.W., Pedlar, J.H., et al. 2011. Revisiting projected shifts in the climate envelopes of North American trees using updated general circulation models. Global Change Biology 17, 2720–2730. https://doi-org.prxy.lib.unbc.ca/10.1111/j.1365-2486.2011.02413.x
